title: FIVE Scream - The True Story xvid ac3
description:
Scream - The True Story
First broadcast 27 Oct 2013
FIVE

Slasher movie Scream spawned one of the most commercially
successful horror franchises in movie history, raking in more
than 400 million dollars in the US alone. Its iconic villain,
known as Ghostface, is a sadistic serial killer who has
entertained and terrified audiences in equal measure since his
first on-screen outing in 1996.

Directed by horror supremo Wes Craven, the man behind the Nightmare
on Elm Street series, the first Scream movie is credited with
revitalising the horror genre. A blend of murder mystery and
slasher violence, it turned the classic horror movie on its head
by playing on the genre's stereotypes and rules.

Set in the small, fictional town of Woodboro, Scream follows high
school student Sydney Prescott (Neve Campbell) as she becomes the
next target of a sadistic masked murderer who first torments his
victims through phone calls.

Although the plotline may seem pure Hollywood fiction, the movie,
penned by screenwriter Kevin Williamson, was partly inspired by
horrific true events and a real masked murderer who terrified a
small town.

Over a week in the summer of 1990, 36-year-old Danny Harold Rolling
stalked, tortured and murdered five young students in Gainesville,
Florida. The serial killings sparked mass panic, a student exodus
and the largest manhunt in Florida's history.

The crime scenes were so horrific that the newspapers dubbed the
killer the Gainesville Ripper. Scream: The True Story explores the
impact Rolling's brutal killing spree had on the university town of
Gainesville, from the media frenzy to the terror and paranoia that
swept across the small community once dubbed by Money Magazine as
America's best.

The film follows the trials and tribulations of the year-long police
investigation to track down Rolling, the rumours, the missed evidence
and the wrongful arrest of a scarred schizophrenic. It tells the story
of how the forensic team finally pieced together the killer's methodology
and the key piece of evidence that finally led to the capture of one of
America's most brutal and frightening killers, revealing that reality
can sometimes be even more terrifying than Hollywood fiction.
